primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic and historical enthronement of Jesus Christ as King over all earthly powers, specifically manifested in the 'transfiguration' of South Africa's political order.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things.
upholding the universe by his word of power.
He subdues the peoples under us.
The kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord.
When he had made purification for sins, he sat down.

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Majesty on High
tekstueel_bewijs: God has planned it that way.
God sits upon his holy throne.

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Oppressed / The World

tekstueel_bewijs: The Holy Spirit... will be at work... in the human story.
God has enlisted us as partners in faith and hope.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, Apartheid, and 'The Devils in Rwanda'
tekstueel_bewijs: Death has no dominion over them.
The human heart is full of evil, and madness is in men’s hearts.
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just political but ontological (Death/Devils), requiring a divine subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The individual believer's struggle against personal demons and the ethical call to resist racism in New York.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Individual Believer / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Faithfulness / Resistance to evil / Respect for neighbors
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly framed as an 'analogy' or consequence of the primary program (Christ's reign).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things.
God has planned it that way.
He will not let her go.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We learn to read and watch the news.
We too are given works of faith.

voorbeelden: Nor can we afford to be starry-eyed.
A day for us deliberately and consciously to rid ourselves of the idea...
As Christians in training for faith, we learn to read...
Upholding the universe by his word of power.
His strength again and again when he was tempted.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Power' of God that enables the 'Faith' of humans. Human action is a participation in a power already released.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Apartheid/Rwanda) to S1 (Christ's Reign) via the 'transfiguration' of political events (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Hope against Hope'—the reality of Christ's victory is present even when not visible.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the mention of Rwanda and the 'madness in men's hearts' prevents cheap optimism.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It interprets historical events as signs of God's primary action. Human figures (Mandela, Tutu) are actantial 'Helpers' or 'Receivers' of a divine 'Pouvoir'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: May God grant that we too will resist them... by extra efforts to show respect.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the Subject of preservation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He is Lord in her life and will not let her go.
When he had made purification for sins, he sat down.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mandela and Tutu are used as examples, but they are framed as 'partners in faith' whose strength comes from the vision of the Ascended Lord.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Tutu's joy is a 'weapon' provided by the 'God squad'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Encouragement and relief; the burden of 'making' history is shifted to Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: Christ 'will not let her go'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Excellent integration of the cosmic (Ascension), the political (South Africa), and the personal (the struggling woman).
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'miracle' in South Africa and the 'devils' in Rwanda.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir-faire' (strength) to resist violence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is described as 'madness' and 'devils'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative, with humans acting as secondary subjects empowered by the primary action.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the current focus on the hearer as one who is 'held' by the Lord.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase emphasis on the Spirit's 'Pouvoir' in the New York context.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'extra efforts' in NY more explicitly to the 'unquenchable joy' of the Spirit.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly articulated via Rwanda and the 'human heart'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses current events not as moral lessons, but as semiotic signs of the Kingdom of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the pathos of the South Africa story; Greimas shows that the story's 'engine' is Christ's actantial sovereignty.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek of Hebrews 1; Greimas shows how that verse functions as the 'Sender's Mandate' for the whole sermon.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'struggling woman' and 'Nelson Mandela' occupy the same actantial slot (Receiver/Secondary Subject), unifying the sermon's scale.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by rooting the heroes' actions in a 'divine hope' rather than human willpower.
